info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:43PM EDT until May 01 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Pigg R Nr Sandy Level, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Water is several feet deep on portions of river road and black walnut road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Saturday afternoon to 25.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 16.2 feet Monday morning. It will rise to 19.2 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.8 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Roanoke (Staunton) River Randolph 24.0 14.3 Fri 8 pm EDT 25.1 21.2 17.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 945 AM EDT.
